item.title: Military Construction Appropriations and Emergency Hurricane Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2005

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 212 - 211 (Roll no. 401). (text: CR H6449)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 212 - 211 (Roll no. 401).(text: CR H6449)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 217 - 197 (Roll no. 400). (consideration: CR H6448)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H6458-6459)

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - The Chair put the question on adoption of the previous question and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Frost demanded the Yeas and Nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question of adoption of the previous question and a possible subsequent roll call vote on adoption of the resolution until later in the legislative day.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 732.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H6449-6457)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 210.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 4837 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be read by paragraph. Bill is open to amendments.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 108-621, by Mrs. Myrick.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 108-621, by Mrs. Myrick.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4837) making appropriations for military construction, family housing, and base realignment and closure for the Department of Defense for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2005.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4837) making appropriations for military construction, family housing, and base realignment and closure for the Department of Defense for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2005.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
